title: Dzhemal Kherhadze
text:
Dzhemal Noyevich Kherhadze (; 2 February 1945 – 11 March 2019) was a <a href="Soviet%20Union">Soviet</a> <a href="Georgia%20%28country%29">Georgian</a> <a href="association%20football">football</a> player and coach.
He was most notable as the co-top scorer of the <a href="1969%20Soviet%20Top%20League">1969 Soviet Top League</a> with 16 goals. He was not awarded the top scorer prize as the <a href="Trud%20%28Russian%20newspaper%29">Trud</a> newspaper which was awarding said prize suspected that the last game of the season, in which he scored a hat-trick to catch up to <a href="Nikolai%20Osyanin">Nikolai Osyanin</a> on the scorers list, was fixed (his team <a href="FC%20Torpedo%20Kutaisi">FC Torpedo Kutaisi</a> played <a href="FC%20SKA%20Rostov-on-Don">FC SKA Rostov-on-Don</a> with a score of 3-3, SKA's <a href="Vladimir%20Proskurin">Vladimir Proskurin</a>, who also scored a hat-trick to catch up with Osyanin, was not awarded the prize either). Formally the decision was justified by Osyanin scoring in "more important" games.
